holidays.name: Kiss and Make Up Day
holidays.description: A quirky holiday dedicated to making amends and resolving arguments by sharing a kiss or a heartfelt apology. It’s the perfect excuse to bury the hatchet with friends, family, or that grumpy coworker!
holidays.origin: Though there’s no official origin, this day draws on the universal desire to fix misunderstandings and foster love, celebrated informally across various cultures.
holidays.funFact: Studies show that kissing releases oxytocin, the 'love hormone,' which helps reduce stress and build trust—perfect scientific backing for this day!

holidays.name: National Banana Split Day
holidays.description: Celebrate this sweet, nostalgic dessert by indulging in a classic banana split topped with ice cream, whipped cream, nuts, and cherries!
holidays.origin: National Banana Split Day honors the invention of the banana split in 1904 at Tassel Pharmacy in Latrobe, Pennsylvania.
holidays.funFact: The original banana split was made for one person, but it quickly became so popular that it turned into a shared treat for two or more!

holidays.name: National Park Service Founders Day
holidays.description: This day marks the anniversary of the founding of the U.S. National Park Service, honoring the preservation of natural and cultural treasures.
holidays.origin: Established on August 25, 1916, President Woodrow Wilson signed the law creating the National Park Service to conserve land for future generations.
holidays.funFact: The National Park Service oversees more than 400 sites, including landmarks, battlefields, and seashores—not just parks!

holidays.name: Loneliest Day
holidays.description: An unusual observance acknowledging feelings of loneliness and encouraging people to reach out to others to create connections and combat isolation.
holidays.origin: A newer, less formal day arising from mental health advocates aiming to destigmatize loneliness and promote community.
holidays.funFact: Research shows that social isolation can be as harmful to health as smoking 15 cigarettes a day—so it’s a day to pick up the phone or hug a friend!
